intro: Sorindeia sparanoi, commonly known as the white-flowered sorindeia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
